comment: For each complex number ` C ` , there does not uniquely exist two complex numbers ` a ` and ` b ` , with ` b ` squared and added to ` a ` resulting in the given complex number ` C ` . Remark: This, together with ~ addsq2reu , is an example showing that the pattern ` E! a e. A E! b e. B ph ` does not necessarily mean "There are unique sets ` a ` and ` b ` fulfilling ` ph ` ), as it is the case with the pattern ` ( E! a e. A E. b e. B ph /\ E! b e. B E. a e. A ph ` . See also comments for ~ df-eu and ~ 2eu4 . (Contributed by AV, 2-Jul-2023.)
